programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Impacts: Climates Change the World
programme.desc: A special edition of this series on COP30 describes the threats facing the Amazon rainforest. We see the potential of agroforestry, and discover Japanese technologies aiding farmers' incomes.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Biz Stream
programme.desc: This upbeat program combines business and economic news with in-depth feature stories that give you a closer look at the latest trends within Japan and around the world.

programme.title: Let's Enjoy MATH
programme.desc: Numbler hides the measuring stick at a shoe shop so that a customer's foot cannot be measured. Barky realizes that the measurement can be made by counting how many 1-centimeter items are needed.

programme.title: Take Tech
programme.desc: A program for upper primary to lower secondary school children to explore the everyday technologies all around them. Each episode takes a piece of familiar tech to find out what it does and how.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Cycle Around Japan
programme.desc: Our cyclist climbs the Kii Mountains in western Japan, and encounters the culture that developed on the secluded slopes. Artisans work with rare black bamboo, and make pigment using an old method.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: NHK WORLD TV Special Program
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a wide range of programs from news, current affairs, documentaries, etc. focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: BOSAI
programme.desc: We look at Self-Defense Forces disaster prep, including their response team's special equipment and techniques, and a new tsunami prediction system.

programme.title: Natural Stone Walls
programme.desc: Shiga / Nagayama Yuko (architect) For 400 years, a group of stonemasons have been building walls using natural stone. Nagayama learns how a stone's qualities are assessed and utilized.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to bag. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: The Seasons of Yamato
programme.desc: A series of poetic videos by Koichi Hozan, a videographer living in Nara, in collaboration with a pianist, Mine Kawakami, for which she plays exclusive pieces, makes you experience each seasons.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: It's late at night, when all are fast asleep. A young man and woman huddle together along the veranda outside of a house, attending to a ... rooster. What could the pair be up to?

programme.title: Grand Sumo Highlights
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a sumo highlights program for fans around the globe. Today the show features all top-division bouts from November 15, Day 7 of the Grand Sumo Tournament in Fukuoka.

programme.title: Sumopedia
programme.desc: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: FOOD: Globalized Japanese Cuisine
programme.desc: There are nearly 190,000 Japanese-style restaurants around the world and 90 percent are run by non-Japanese chefs. We look at how global cultures and trends are updating Japanese cuisine.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: NHK WORLD TV Special Program
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a wide range of programs from news, current affairs, documentaries, etc. focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: J-Melo
programme.desc: Join May J. for great Japanese music! This week, three energetic idol groups: 12-member group Not Equal Me, Hello! Project group Angerme, and Cho Tokimeki Sendenbu, who just released a new single.

programme.title: Little Charo
programme.desc: Little Charo is an animation series about a Japanese dog who got lost in NY. \.

programme.title: Japanology Plus Mini
programme.desc: Over 70% of Japanese people are said to use eyeglasses. We visit Sabae, in Fukui, where over 90% of Japan's glasses are made, and explore the history of Japanese eyewear and the latest technology.

programme.title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
programme.desc: We head to Yashima, where the local boss cat leads us to a temple along the Shikoku Pilgrimage. The temple grounds are home to cats that nap, play, and greet pilgrims and other visitors.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Cycle Around Japan
programme.desc: Many now rarely-seen crafts live on in the remote villages of the Kii Mountains. We see aged artisans producing pigment from pine tree soot and crafting traditional wooden buckets and tubs.

programme.title: Rockie and Her Friends
programme.desc: Puppet action show for children. In a distant post-human future where surviving creatures have formed a community, new-breed dinosaur girl Rockie sets out on hilarious adventures with her schoolmates.

programme.title: u & i
programme.desc: This show for kids promotes a greater understanding for people with difficulties and helps develop empathy. With the help of two fairies, the main character thinks about what can be done to help.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
programme.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

programme.title: Okinawa
programme.desc: Okinawa Prefecture is a group of subtropical islands in the far south of Japan. We examine its past and present, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: The Holiest Place.

programme.title: Grand Sumo Highlights
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a sumo highlights program for fans around the globe. Today the show features all top-division bouts from November 15, Day 7 of the Grand Sumo Tournament in Fukuoka.

programme.title: Sumopedia
programme.desc: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Ramen Japan
programme.desc: What makes these one-of-a-kind handmade noodles so unique?! Come to Sano for a taste you won't find anywhere else!

programme.title: Core Kyoto Mini
programme.desc: Crests are symbols of families and organizations. Once the privilege of the imperial and samurai classes, they were adopted by merchants and the populace as marks of pride.

programme.title: Easy Japanese for Work
programme.desc: Today: fielding an urgent request on the phone. Dong Van Huu from Vietnam designs blueprints at an architecture company. In a roleplay, he fields a call about blueprints that are missing information.

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Kawahara Takuya upcycles discarded jeans. His partner, Yamasawa Ryoji buys old denim overseas by the ton. Together these denim devotees make it cooler than cool once again.

programme.title: Education Chance Opens the World
programme.desc: Maxine is a university student. She joined a school providing educational support and life advice to international students wanting to enter Japanese high school. This experience changed her life.

programme.title: Impacts: Climates Change the World
programme.desc: The entire Earth is affected by climate change, occurring with a greater speed and scale than ever before. This program uses scientific data and the latest findings to raise awareness on its impact.

programme.title: Natural Stone Walls
programme.desc: Shiga / Nagayama Yuko (architect) For 400 years, a group of stonemasons have been building walls using natural stone. Nagayama learns how a stone's qualities are assessed and utilized.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: People from around the globe who put down roots in Japan offer a glimpse into their lives and the hardships they face in Japanese society.

programme.title: Time-Lapse Japan
programme.desc: The Jomon period dates roughly from 13,000 to 300 BC. We examine various aspects of Jomon society, with footage from time-lapse creator Shimizu Daisuke. This time: Lacquer.

programme.title: BOSAI
programme.desc: We look at Self-Defense Forces disaster prep, including their response team's special equipment and techniques, and a new tsunami prediction system.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to ghosts. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: A new version of Radio Japan's Easy Japanese is coming to TV first this time. Learn simple expressions you can put to use whether you're visiting or staying. Tune in and start speaking.

programme.title: Culture Crossroads
programme.desc: Culture Crossroads comprises several regular programs with the theme of creating a multicultural society. They look at international exchange programs and give tips on disaster preparedness.

programme.title: Hello! NHK World Japan
programme.desc: We intorduce the contents and activities of NHK WORLD-JAPAN to make the station and programs known to more people all over the world. This is the window of the station to the world.

programme.title: NHK News 7

programme.title: Newsroom Tokyo

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Direct and in-depth. Interviews exploring the minds and motivations of the leaders, visionaries, artists and entrepreneurs who are changing our world.

programme.title: NHK World Selection
programme.desc: A selection of acclaimed programs from NHK's domestic channels dubbed into English.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: We visit one of the most famous cherry blossom spots in Edo. Flower viewing parties were for eating, drinking and making merry. It was also an opportunity for young men and women to mingle.

programme.title: Newsroom Tokyo
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to ghosts. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: A new version of Radio Japan's Easy Japanese is coming to TV first this time. Learn simple expressions you can put to use whether you're visiting or staying. Tune in and start speaking.

programme.title: Culture Crossroads
programme.desc: Culture Crossroads comprises several regular programs with the theme of creating a multicultural society. They look at international exchange programs and give tips on disaster preparedness.

programme.title: Hello! NHK World Japan
programme.desc: We intorduce the contents and activities of NHK WORLD-JAPAN to make the station and programs known to more people all over the world. This is the window of the station to the world.

programme.title: NHK Newsline
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.
